document_data.name: House Huntsilver
document_data.mainbody: '''Huntsilver''' was a noble house of [[Cormyr]]. An "old blood" family, it was considered one of the Royal Houses, owing to its close ties to the [[Obarskyr]] royal line.<ref>
document_data.Base:
The family lived in [[Huntsilver Palace]],<ref> situated beyond the [[Royal Gardens]] in [[Suzail]].

They also had holdings in [[Dhedluk (town)|Dhedluk]] and [[Thunderstone]].
document_data.History:
After the [[Silver (human house)|Silver]] family split, they formed the Huntsilver, [[Truesilver]], and [[Crownsilver]] families. The Huntsilvers were established by [[245 DR]].<ref>

The Huntsilvers chose not to take sides when civil war erupted between Regent [[Salember]] and Prince [[Rhigaerd II]] in the {{YearlinkName|1268}}. Instead, they equivocated when Salember demanded soldiers and aid.<ref>

In the event of King [[Azoun IV]]'s presumed death in the [[abraxus incident]], the Huntsilvers were among those families who preferred replacing the monarchy with a ruling council, rather than a regency, in order to free Cormyr from what they saw as Obarskyr tyranny.<ref>

The fortunes of the Huntsilver family wavered for a while, when their sons died in wars with [[Sembia]]. Their daughters had been married to the [[Crownsilver]]s and [[Truesilver]]s, and were still awaiting heirs.{{Cite dungeon/198/Cormyr Royale: The Royal Court of the Forest Kingdom}} Eventually, their fortunes must have shifted, for in the {{YearlinkName|1486}}, they were a strong enough force for [[Raedra Obarskyr]] to look to for acknowledgement of her ascension.
document_data.Personality: The Huntsilver family was seen as aloof in the mid–14{{th}} century.<ref>
document_data.Activities:
The Huntsilvers were historically focused on managing Cormyr's forests and their resources. In the early years of the kingdom, the family organized the systematic development of forests for farmland. In the 14th century, Huntsilvers had a prominent role in clearing the [[Hullack Forest]].

Members of the Huntsilver family rarely appeared at the Royal Court, except on important occasions or on issues regarding the forests of Cormyr.

Members.14{{th}} Century:
* [[Agrast Huntsilver]], cousin to [[Elvarin Crownsilver]].
* [[Cordryn Huntsilver]]<ref>
* [[Elanna Huntsilver]], Maestoon's wife.<ref>
* [[Hundilavatar Huntsilver]], rumored to have pursued [[Tanalasta Obarskyr]] for courting.
* [[Jostlyn Huntsilver]], [[Knights Royal|Knight Royal]] and personal bodyguard of [[Filfaeril Obarskyr]] in the mid–14{{th}} century.{{Cite dragon annual/2000/After the Dragon: The Kingdom of Cormyr Today|62}}
* [[Maestoon Huntsilver]], head of family ''circa'' [[1367 DR]], and game warden of the [[King's Forest]].
* [[Shalanna Huntsilver]], Maestoon's daughter.<ref>
Members.15th Century:
One of the following was the leader of House Huntsilver, as of [[1483 DR]].
* [[Belvedere Huntsilver]], am aged member of the house from the town of [[Wheloon]].
* [[Oriphaun Huntsilver]], a relic collector and an adventurer who helped to push back [[Netherese]] invasion of [[Wheloon]] in the 15{{th}} century DR.
* [[Pelarra Huntsilver]], mother of Glorin and Roatha Huntsilver. She offered her house's support to Raedra Obarskyr's ascension to the throne.
* [[Roatha Huntsilver]], twin sister of Glorin, and daughter of Pelarra. She was a child as of [[1486 DR]], blonde, and possessed dark eyes. Her mother pushed her to converse with Raedra instead of nudging Glorin.
* [[Glorin Huntsilver]], twin brother of Roatha.
